report_title: Industry Research: Foreign Currency Exchange Services in the US
executive_summary: The Foreign Currency Exchange Services industry was aided over the five years to 2021 by continued growth in international trade and travel. Downstream corporate clients rely on industry operators for business-to-business payment services, while downstream individuals generally use credit and debit card processing services and currency exchange offerings. The anticipated 2.7% annualized increase in the total value of world trade has boosted demand from these major markets during the five-year period. Moreover, technological change in the form of improved debit card offerings and mobile apps has made industry services more convenient. As a result of these trends, industry revenue is expected to increase an annualized 0.3% to $778.2 million over the five years to 2021; this growth includes an expected 25.6% rise in 2021 alone. Despite a steady increase in demand during the period, cost-based competition has led profit to shrink during the period. The major reason for this decline is the spread of COVID-19 (coronavirus) in 2020, in which revenue declined 29.4% as domestic and international travel was affected. Most industry operators are small in size and handle a correspondingly small number of transactions. Annual gross foreign currency exchange transactions exceed $500,000 for a small minority of industry operators. Location decisions of both large and small operators generally correlate with domestic population and travel trends. Accordingly, California, New York and Florida account for large portions of industry establishments, given their substantial population figures and reputations as tourist destinations. These areas are also known for as businesses hubs which also necessitates business-to-business payment services as well.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Foreign Currency Exchange Services industry has performed relatively well over the five years to 2021, largely due to improved trading volumes and growing numbers of international flights. Industry operators predominately provide business-to-business payment services, credit and debit card processing services and traditional currency exchange. Accordingly, the expected 2.7% annualized increase in the total value of world trade has increased demand from downstream businesses over the five years to 2021.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Competition from major banks dampened revenue
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Nevertheless, competition from major bank-holding companies that do not charge fees for industry-relevant services has dampened revenue prospects in recent years. Despite this potential threat, industry revenue is expected to increase an annualized 0.3% to $778.2 million over the five years to 2021.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Revenue jumped 25.6% in 2021 after COVID-19 decline
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: This growth includes an increase of 25.6% in 2021 alone, due in part to increased demand for foreign currency exchange services stemming from rising numbers of inbound flights by non-US residents and international flights by domestic residents. This jump in revenue in 2021 is due to decline in international trips by US residents and inbound trips by non-US residents in 2020 due to spread of COVID-19 (coronavirus).

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Revenue projected to grow 10.9% annually over next 5 years
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the five years to 2026, industry revenue is forecast to increase at an annualized rate of 10.9% to $1.3 billion. The factors that affect downstream demand levels, including trade and travel, are anticipated to continue improving over the five years to 2026.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Online and mobile offerings to drive transactions
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the next five years, industry operators are expected to continue to develop websites and apps that make it even easier for individuals and businesses to make foreign currency transaction wherever and whenever they need to. This is expected to drive the total number of transactions industry operators complete, helping industry revenue grow during the five-year period.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Profit margins expected to improve to 15.7%
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Despite this trend, continued improvements in downstream demand levels from both consumer and business clients, as well as operational efficiencies stemming from increased reliance on scalable online and app-based services, will boost the industry's average profit margin (measured as earnings before interest and taxes) from 15.4% of industry revenue in 2021 to 15.7% in 2026.

industry_definition: This industry includes operators that offer foreign currency exchange services to consumers and businesses. Industry services include business-to-business payment services, credit and debit card processing services for foreign transactions and traditional currency exchange. Bank-holding companies that do not charge fees for foreign currency exchange services are not included in the industry, while industry-specific ATMs are not considered establishments.
key_trends: Competition from major bank-holding companies has dampened revenue prospects in recent years
Airports are a common location choice for many industry operators given their proximity to international travelers
Foreign currency exchange services are often provided among a range of offerings for many providers
Operators are expected to benefit from domestic and international consumers traveling abroad
Rising downstream demand and increased operational efficiencies will boost profit
Online sales are anticipated to grow as a share of total industry transactions
The factors affecting downstream demand are anticipated to continue improving during the five-year period

market_segmentation.segment_description: Businesses rely on industry services to pay suppliers, distributors and customers, as well as workers in foreign markets. Due to the increased globalization of commerce, this market has grown as a share of revenue over the five years to 2021.

This market segment is anticipated to account for only 10.7% of industry revenue in 2021, despite the likeliness of consumers within this age category to travel. This market's low contribution to industry revenue is due to lower disposable income levels among these individuals.
This market is expected to account for 15.4% of industry revenue in 2021. This large contribution to the industry reflects the significantly strong income earning potential of this market segment.
This segment is expected to be a major contributor to industry revenue. IBISWorld estimates that these population segment earns the largest share of income among the general population.
This segment is expected to be a major contributor to industry revenue. IBISWorld estimates that these population segment earns the largest share of income among the general population.

This market segment is anticipated to account for 20.3% of industry revenue in 2021. Despite a wide range of individuals that fall into this age bracket, the segment barely accounts for a larger portion of industry revenue than much more defined age brackets.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Exchange services performed by retail banks
products_and_services.product_description: The largest product segment includes the foreign exchange services offered by retail banks. This high market share largely reflects the vast number of enterprises that use their existing banking relationship to facilitate cross-border payments.

ATM operations are the second-largest product segment, accounting for an estimated 17.9% of industry revenue in 2021. ATMs have benefited from the need for convenience from consumers, especially inbound tourists.
One of the fastest-growing product segments is the online exchange of foreign currencies. In 2021, online foreign exchange is expected to account for 13.9% of industry revenue.
In-store foreign exchanges services include specialist foreign exchange operations. An example of this is Travelex's retail store branches that are located primarily in inner city locations.

tier_2_suppliers: Office Supply Stores in the US
Internet Service Providers in the US
Wired Telecommunications Carriers in the US
tier_1_buyers: Finance and Insurance in the US
tier_2_buyers: Professional, Scientific and Technical Services in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Several factors influence demand for the Foreign Currency Exchange Services industry, including the number of tourists traveling to and from the United States. Demand for international travel significantly influences the industry, since travelers require foreign currency when overseas.

Household disposable income is particularly relevant to industry demand, as the level of disposable income within a household will determine the amount of time allocated to foreign travel. As disposable income rises, demand for traveling also tends to increase.
Industry growth is affected by consumer confidence, as an increase leads to higher demand for international products and a willingness to spend on traveling.

The strength of the US dollar and global economic conditionals also affect the industry. For instance, as the value of the dollar has appreciated in recent years, domestic consumers have been enticed to travel abroad to reap the benefit of the dollar's increased purchasing power in foreign territories.

international_trade_points.trade_description: The Foreign Currency Exchange Services industry serves the exchange of foreign currencies within the United States through retail and online transactions. As a result, no international trade of any merchandise occurs.

business_locations.location_description: Locations for the Foreign Currency Exchange Services industry are concentrated in the Southeast region of the United States.
Locations for the Foreign Currency Exchange Services industry are concentrated in the Great Lakes region of the United States.
Locations for the Foreign Currency Exchange Services industry are concentrated in the West region of the United States.
Locations for the Foreign Currency Exchange Services industry are concentrated in the Mid-Atlantic region of the United States.

regulations_points.regulation_description: If classified as a money service business or money transmission agent, operators must comply with relevant regulations set by regulators.
Operators must comply with federal and state regulations related to privacy of customer information and reporting of financial transactions.
The Financial Crimes Enforcement Network sets strict guidelines, standards and rules that industry operators must follow.

basis_points.basis_description: Operators offer the same service of trading domestic currency for foreign currency. Price competition is the main source through transaction fees and exchange rates.
Competition from major commercial banks offering foreign exchange services, sometimes with no fees for customers.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The top two operators account for less than 20% of total industry revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Operators place emphasis on prime locations with high foot traffic, leading to premium prices paid for rent in areas like airports and malls.
Wages account for the industry's largest expense at an estimated 27.7% of revenue in 2021.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Start-up capital expenses are largely limited to purchasing or renting facilities. The heaviest equipment owned are computers used to calculate exchange rates.
The industry is service-oriented and relies on labor rather than heavy equipment or technology. Wages comprise a large cost segment at 27.7% of revenue.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Revenue is influenced by cross-border trade, economic activity and tourism, leading to noticeable swings.
The industry experienced a major 29.4% revenue decline in 2020 due to the spread of COVID-19.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Online foreign exchange trading platforms have provided more choices for smaller players and potential entrants.
Several operators offer mobile apps for services like kiosk tracking and currency quotes, providing convenience.
The percentage of services conducted online is increasing, reducing reliance on human capital.

FAQs.question: Do you have a strong reputation among customers? Have you had any problems with reliability in the past?
FAQs.answer: Having a good reputation, especially with timely foreign exchange quotes and competitive spreads, is important for success in this industry.

FAQs.question: How do you insulate against the risk of price fluctuations? How closely do you monitor the fluctuations in exchange rates?
FAQs.answer: Being able to hedge against volatility in foreign exchange is crucial for industry operators that hold large reserves of physical currency.

FAQs.question: Is your company dominant in any particular regional markets? What range does your company have in terms of viable operating area?
FAQs.answer: Location is important for many industry operators, especially kiosks and other physical retail establishments. This is because certain locations such as airports and tourist destinations have higher demand for currency exchange.

FAQs.question: Who is your biggest competitor in terms of price? How do you distinguish yourself from your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators experience intense competition from large commercial banks, such as Wells Fargo, that do not charge for traditional foreign currency exchange services.

FAQs.question: Do you track the number of outbound travelers from the United States? How do you secure access to a wide variety of foreign currencies?
FAQs.answer: US consumers traveling abroad often exchange US dollars to the currency of the country they are visiting prior to their trip.

FAQs.question: How does the rising value of trade affect your company?
How much of your revenue comes from business to business transactions?
FAQs.answer: Downstream commercial clients represent a crucial market for industry operators. This market predominately relies on business-to-business payment services on foreign transactions.
